software-engineer.title: Software Engineer
software-engineer.tagline: AI writes the code. Humans decide what to build and why.

tasks.description: AI generates endpoints, models, forms, and scaffolding near-perfectly from natural language prompts.
AI generates comprehensive test suites from source code with high coverage.
AI identifies bugs from error logs and suggests fixes, though complex logic bugs still need humans.
AI flags style issues, security vulnerabilities, and common anti-patterns automatically.
AI generates accurate docstrings, READMEs, and API documentation from code.
AI suggests refactoring patterns but struggles with large-scale architectural changes.
AI reads API docs and generates integration code, though edge cases require manual handling.
AI suggests schemas from requirements but misses normalization nuances and scaling considerations.
Requires understanding business context, team capabilities, and long-term tradeoffs. Still deeply human.
Navigating stakeholders, resolving conflicts, and aligning priorities remains entirely human.

companies.name: OpenAI
companies.threat: Generating production-ready code from natural language descriptions

companies.name: Anthropic
companies.threat: Autonomous coding agent that handles multi-file edits and terminal commands

companies.name: Cursor
companies.threat: AI-first IDE replacing traditional coding workflow entirely

companies.name: GitHub
companies.threat: End-to-end issue-to-PR automation with planning and implementation

companies.name: Replit
companies.threat: Full-stack app generation from plain English with auto-deployment

timeline.description: AI handles 60-80% of routine coding. Senior engineers supervise AI output. Junior hiring shrinks 30%.
AI agents handle full feature development. Engineers become AI supervisors. 1 engineer does work of 5.
Most software is AI-generated. Human engineers focus on architecture, ethics, and novel problem-solving.

skills.description: Master prompt engineering for code generation. Learn to review, debug, and orchestrate AI output.
The last frontier — understanding tradeoffs, scalability, and business context that AI can't grasp.
Shift from 'how to build it' to 'what to build and why.' Bridge business needs and technical execution.
Understand the tools you're working with. Know how models work, their limitations, and how to fine-tune.
The engineers who survive will lead teams, manage stakeholders, and make judgment calls AI cannot.

data-engineer.title: Data Engineer
data-engineer.tagline: AI automates the pipelines. Humans design the data strategy.

tasks.description: AI generates Spark, Airflow, and dbt pipelines from schema descriptions and data samples.
AI writes complex queries, window functions, and optimizes execution plans near-perfectly.
AI detects anomalies, schema drift, and data quality issues automatically in production.
AI suggests dimensional models and schemas but misses business nuance and evolving requirements.
AI generates data dictionaries, lineage docs, and catalog entries from pipeline code.
AI writes Terraform/IaC for data lakes, warehouses, and streaming infra with minimal guidance.
AI identifies bottlenecks but complex distributed system optimization still needs deep expertise.
Defining what data to collect, retention policies, and compliance frameworks requires business judgment.
Translating data capabilities to business users and managing expectations remains deeply human.

companies.name: Fivetran
companies.threat: Zero-code data ingestion replacing custom pipeline work

companies.name: dbt Labs
companies.threat: AI-assisted transformations reducing SQL engineering effort by 70%

companies.name: Databricks
companies.threat: Auto-optimizing lakehouse that self-manages performance and governance

companies.name: Monte Carlo
companies.threat: AI-powered anomaly detection replacing manual data quality checks

companies.name: Snowflake
companies.threat: In-warehouse AI that auto-tunes queries and suggests schema improvements

timeline.description: Routine ETL is 80% automated. Data engineers shift to orchestration and strategy. Junior pipeline roles vanish.
Self-healing pipelines become standard. Engineers focus on data products, governance, and ML feature stores.
Data infrastructure is largely self-managing. Remaining roles focus on strategy, novel architectures, and AI-data feedback loops.

skills.description: Shift from building pipelines to designing data products with clear business value and SLAs.
Build and maintain ML training pipelines, feature stores, and model serving infrastructure.
Master GDPR, CCPA, and data sovereignty requirements — the human judgment layer AI can't replace.
Design complex event-driven systems with Kafka, Flink — harder to automate than batch ETL.
Deep understanding of the industry's data needs makes you irreplaceable even as tools improve.

frontend-developer.title: Frontend Developer
frontend-developer.tagline: AI generates the UI. Humans craft the experience.

tasks.description: AI converts Figma designs to pixel-perfect HTML/CSS/Tailwind with near-zero errors.
AI generates React/Vue/Angular components from descriptions, including props, state, and styling.
AI handles breakpoints and responsive layouts automatically with Tailwind and CSS Grid.
AI generates form handling, validation logic, and Redux/Zustand state patterns from specs.
AI writes fetch hooks, error handling, and caching logic for REST/GraphQL endpoints.
AI handles basic Framer Motion and CSS animations but struggles with complex choreographed sequences.
AI adds ARIA labels and roles but misses nuanced accessibility patterns for complex widgets.
AI suggests code splitting and lazy loading but holistic performance strategy needs human analysis.
Creating scalable, consistent design systems that evolve with product needs requires deep UX thinking.
Understanding user psychology, interaction patterns, and emotional design remains deeply human.

companies.name: Vercel
companies.threat: Text-to-UI generation producing production-ready React components instantly

companies.name: StackBlitz
companies.threat: Full frontend app generation from prompts with live preview and deployment

companies.name: Locofy
companies.threat: Automated design-to-code conversion eliminating manual frontend translation

companies.name: Framer
companies.threat: AI-generated websites with animations, interactions, and responsive design built-in

companies.name: Cursor
companies.threat: AI pair-programmer that understands UI context and generates full page layouts

timeline.description: AI generates 70-80% of UI code. Frontend devs review, customize, and handle edge cases. Junior frontend demand drops 40%.
Design-to-deployed-app takes minutes. Frontend devs become UX engineers focusing on experience and accessibility.
Most UI is AI-generated on-demand. Remaining roles focus on design systems, complex interactions, and brand experience.

skills.description: Bridge the gap between design and code — understand user psychology, not just React components.
Build and maintain scalable design systems that AI uses as building blocks.
Deep a11y knowledge is hard to automate and increasingly mandated by law.
Core Web Vitals, bundle optimization, and runtime performance require holistic thinking.
Master v0, Cursor, Bolt — become the person who ships 10x faster by directing AI tools effectively.

backend-developer.title: Backend Developer
backend-developer.tagline: AI builds the APIs. Humans architect the systems.

tasks.description: AI generates complete API endpoints, middleware, and route handlers from OpenAPI specs or descriptions.
AI writes ORM models, migrations, and query builders near-perfectly from schema descriptions.
AI implements OAuth, JWT, RBAC patterns but security edge cases still need expert review.
AI generates structured error handling, logging middleware, and monitoring integration code.
AI sets up Redis/Memcached patterns but cache invalidation strategy requires architectural judgment.
AI handles basic service-to-service calls but event-driven architectures and saga patterns need human design.
AI suggests basic optimizations but load testing strategy, sharding, and distributed systems need humans.
Designing distributed systems, choosing between monolith vs microservices, handling CAP tradeoffs — deeply human.
Threat modeling, penetration testing strategy, and zero-trust architecture require expert judgment.
Tracing issues across distributed systems with cascading failures requires deep institutional knowledge.

companies.name: Anthropic
companies.threat: Autonomous backend development from specs including database, API, and deployment

companies.name: OpenAI
companies.threat: Generating production-grade backend systems from natural language

companies.name: Supabase
companies.threat: Auto-generated backend with auth, database, and real-time subscriptions — no code needed

companies.name: Hasura
companies.threat: Instant GraphQL APIs from databases, eliminating 80% of backend boilerplate

companies.name: Railway
companies.threat: One-click backend deployment with auto-scaling, reducing DevOps overhead to near-zero

timeline.description: AI generates 70% of backend code. Engineers focus on architecture decisions and security reviews.
AI handles full microservice implementation. Backend devs become system architects and reliability engineers.
Backend infrastructure is largely self-generating. Human roles focus on novel architectures and business-critical systems.

skills.description: Master CAP theorem, consensus algorithms, and event-driven architectures — the hardest to automate.
Threat modeling, zero-trust architecture, and compliance — high-stakes decisions AI shouldn't make alone.
SLOs, incident response, chaos engineering — keeping systems running requires human judgment.
Build the backend systems that serve AI models — inference pipelines, vector databases, RAG architectures.
Deep business domain understanding lets you model systems that actually match real-world complexity.

full-stack-developer.title: Full-Stack Developer
full-stack-developer.tagline: AI builds entire apps. Humans own the product vision.

tasks.description: AI generates complete Next.js/Remix apps with auth, database, and deployment from a single prompt.
AI builds entire CRUD applications with forms, tables, and API routes in minutes.
AI connects frontend components to backend APIs with proper error handling and loading states.
AI generates Prisma schemas, migrations, and seed data from natural language requirements.
AI implements complete auth flows with social login, MFA, and session management.
AI configures CI/CD, Docker, and cloud deployment with auto-scaling for standard setups.
Multi-step workflows, payment processing, and domain-specific logic still need human design.
What features to build, how to prioritize, and when to ship — pure human judgment.
Watching users struggle, interviewing customers, and iterating based on real feedback is irreplaceably human.

companies.name: Replit
companies.threat: Natural language to deployed full-stack apps in minutes

companies.name: Vercel
companies.threat: AI-generated production apps with built-in deployment and scaling

companies.name: StackBlitz
companies.threat: Browser-based full-stack generation with live editing and instant deploy

companies.name: Cursor
companies.threat: AI-first development environment that understands full codebase context

companies.name: Lovable
companies.threat: AI software engineer that builds and iterates on full apps from conversations

timeline.description: AI generates 70% of a typical app. Full-stack devs become AI-powered 10x builders. Solo founders ship faster.
Non-technical people build production apps with AI. Full-stack devs pivot to complex, custom systems.
Standard apps are commoditized. Remaining full-stack roles focus on novel products, AI integration, and custom enterprise systems.

skills.description: Ship MVPs in hours, not weeks. Master the AI toolchain to validate ideas at unprecedented speed.
Combine technical skills with product thinking — the rarest and most valuable combination.
Third-party APIs, payment systems, real-time features — the messy real-world stuff AI struggles with.
Lead teams, make architecture decisions, and mentor — the human layer above code generation.
With AI as your co-developer, the best full-stack move is building your own product.

devops-sre.title: DevOps / SRE Engineer
devops-sre.tagline: AI automates the ops. Humans handle the chaos.

tasks.description: AI generates Terraform, Pulumi, and CloudFormation templates from architecture descriptions.
AI creates GitHub Actions, Jenkins, and ArgoCD pipelines from deployment requirements.
AI generates Kubernetes manifests, Helm charts, and Docker configs from service specs.
AI configures Prometheus, Grafana dashboards, and alert rules from SLO definitions.
AI correlates logs, identifies root causes, and suggests fixes for common failure patterns.
AI scans for vulnerabilities and suggests fixes but holistic security posture needs human judgment.
AI forecasts resource needs from historical data but business context affects scaling decisions.
Real-time incident triage, communication, and novel failure diagnosis requires human judgment under pressure.
Designing for failure, chaos engineering strategy, and reliability culture are deeply human.
AI identifies waste but architectural decisions that balance cost, performance, and reliability need humans.

companies.name: Pulumi
companies.threat: Natural language to complete cloud infrastructure with auto-generated IaC

companies.name: Harness
companies.threat: AI-powered CI/CD that auto-tunes deployment strategies and rollback policies

companies.name: Datadog
companies.threat: AI-driven observability that auto-detects issues and suggests resolutions

companies.name: Wiz
companies.threat: AI cloud security that automatically remediates vulnerabilities across the stack

companies.name: Kubecost
companies.threat: Automated Kubernetes cost optimization reducing cloud spend by 40%

timeline.description: Routine ops automated. SREs focus on reliability strategy and incident response. Junior DevOps roles shrink.
Self-healing infrastructure becomes standard. SREs become reliability architects and chaos engineers.
Cloud infrastructure is largely autonomous. Human SREs handle novel failures, security incidents, and strategic reliability.

skills.description: Design systems for failure — chaos engineering, game days, and resilience patterns that outlast any automation.
Build internal developer platforms — the abstraction layer between AI-generated code and production infrastructure.
Incident response, threat hunting, and security architecture — high-stakes work AI assists but can't lead.
Manage GPU clusters, model serving, and ML pipeline infrastructure — the new frontier of ops.
Optimize multi-million dollar cloud bills — requires business context AI doesn't have.

qa-test-engineer.title: QA / Test Engineer
qa-test-engineer.tagline: AI writes the tests. But who tests the AI?

tasks.description: AI generates comprehensive unit test suites from source code with high branch coverage.
AI creates API and integration tests from endpoint documentation and Postman collections.
AI generates Playwright/Cypress tests from user stories or screen recordings.
AI auto-heals broken selectors and updates tests when UI changes.
AI generates realistic test data, edge cases, and boundary conditions from schema definitions.
AI generates load test scripts but realistic traffic patterns and thresholds need human expertise.
AI runs OWASP scans automatically but creative penetration testing requires human thinking.
Human intuition for 'something feels off,' edge case discovery, and usability issues can't be automated.
Deciding what to test, risk assessment, and quality gates require business context and judgment.

companies.name: Codium AI
companies.threat: AI-generated test suites that understand code intent, not just coverage

companies.name: TestRigor
companies.threat: Plain English test automation that self-heals when UI changes

companies.name: Mabl
companies.threat: Auto-healing, self-maintaining E2E test automation platform

companies.name: Diffblue
companies.threat: Fully autonomous unit test writing for Java — no human needed

companies.name: QA Wolf
companies.threat: AI-generated and maintained test suites as a service, replacing QA teams entirely

timeline.description: AI writes 80% of test code. Manual QA teams shrink 50%. Test engineers become quality strategists.
AI-generated tests auto-maintain and expand. QA engineers focus on AI testing and security.
Testing is largely autonomous. Remaining QA roles focus on testing AI systems, compliance, and safety-critical software.

skills.description: Testing AI models for bias, hallucination, and safety — the new frontier of QA that's uniquely human.
Penetration testing and threat modeling require creative human thinking that AI can't replicate.
Design testing strategies, CI/CD quality gates, and testing infrastructure at scale.
Load testing, capacity planning, and performance optimization require holistic system understanding.
FDA, SOC2, HIPAA compliance testing — high-stakes work where human judgment is legally required.

mobile-developer.title: Mobile Developer
mobile-developer.tagline: AI codes the app. Humans craft the mobile experience.

tasks.description: AI generates SwiftUI/Jetpack Compose/React Native screens from designs or descriptions.
AI writes networking layers, API calls, and data parsing with proper error handling.
AI implements Redux, Provider, and other state patterns from data flow descriptions.
AI sets up SQLite, CoreData, Room with proper caching strategies.
AI configures Firebase, APNS, and notification handling but deep linking edge cases need humans.
Memory management, battery optimization, and platform-specific UX patterns require deep native knowledge.
AI assists with Fastlane configs and metadata but review guidelines and rejection handling need humans.
Complex sync strategies, conflict resolution, and offline-first data architecture need expert design.
Camera, sensors, Bluetooth, and AR features require deep platform knowledge and testing.
Making an app feel native on both iOS and Android while sharing code requires nuanced human judgment.

companies.name: Expo
companies.threat: Full React Native app generation with OTA updates and zero native config

companies.name: FlutterFlow
companies.threat: Visual Flutter app builder with AI that generates screens from prompts

companies.name: Cursor
companies.threat: AI-powered mobile development understanding iOS/Android codebases

companies.name: Apple
companies.threat: Xcode-integrated AI that generates SwiftUI views and handles platform APIs

companies.name: Draftbit
companies.threat: Visual mobile app builder with AI-generated components and logic

timeline.description: AI generates 65% of mobile app code. Developers focus on native performance and complex interactions.
AI handles full app generation for standard patterns. Mobile devs specialize in AR, ML, and hardware integration.
Standard mobile apps are commoditized. Mobile engineers focus on novel experiences — AR, IoT, health sensors, AI on-device.

skills.description: ARKit, RealityKit, SceneKit — immersive experiences that AI can't design but can help build.
CoreML, TensorFlow Lite — running AI models on mobile devices is the next frontier.
Deep iOS or Android architecture knowledge that goes beyond what AI can generate.
Secure enclaves, certificate pinning, jailbreak detection — high-stakes mobile security.
Bluetooth LE, NFC, health sensors — connecting apps to the physical world.

ml-engineer.title: ML Engineer
ml-engineer.tagline: AI helps build AI. But someone has to build the AI that builds AI.

tasks.description: AutoML and AI-assisted fine-tuning handle hyperparameter search but architecture choices need expertise.
AI automates feature engineering and data cleaning but domain-specific preprocessing needs human insight.
AI generates eval benchmarks and tests but understanding what metrics matter requires domain knowledge.
AI generates training loops, data loaders, and experiment tracking code from descriptions.
AI configures model serving with Triton, TensorRT, and auto-scaling but production optimization needs expertise.
AI translates papers to code reasonably well but novel architectures require deep understanding.
Designing new model architectures, loss functions, and training strategies requires deep research intuition.
End-to-end ML system architecture — data flywheel, feedback loops, and production reliability — needs senior judgment.
Ensuring models are safe, unbiased, and aligned with human values is a deeply human responsibility.
Deciding what problems to solve and which approaches to pursue requires scientific intuition and creativity.

companies.name: Google DeepMind
companies.threat: Pushing the frontier of what AI can do, raising the bar for all ML engineers

companies.name: OpenAI
companies.threat: General-purpose AI that reduces the need for task-specific ML models

companies.name: HuggingFace
companies.threat: Democratizing ML with one-click fine-tuning and pre-trained model zoo

companies.name: Weights & Biases
companies.threat: AI-assisted experiment tracking, hyperparameter optimization, and model evaluation

companies.name: Anthropic
companies.threat: AI alignment research that may eventually automate safety evaluation itself

timeline.description: AutoML handles standard tasks. ML engineers focus on fine-tuning, RAG, and production ML systems. Demand stays strong.
AI assists in model design. ML engineers become AI system architects, focusing on safety, reliability, and novel applications.
AI designs its own models for standard tasks. Human ML engineers work on frontier research, safety, and AGI-adjacent problems.

skills.description: Fine-tuning, RAG, prompt engineering, and building LLM-powered applications — the hottest ML skill in 2026.
Getting models reliably into production — monitoring, A/B testing, and continuous training pipelines.
The most important and hardest-to-automate skill — ensuring AI systems behave as intended.
Bridge research and production — implement papers, run experiments at scale, and iterate fast.
Healthcare ML, financial ML, scientific ML — combining ML expertise with deep domain knowledge.

data-scientist.title: Data Scientist
data-scientist.tagline: AI crunches the numbers. Humans ask the right questions.

tasks.description: AI generates comprehensive EDA with visualizations, distributions, and correlations from any dataset.
AI selects and fits appropriate statistical models, though interpreting results still needs domain expertise.
AI creates publication-quality charts and dashboards from natural language descriptions of insights.
AI suggests and generates features from raw data but creative domain-specific features need human insight.
AI drafts data reports and summaries but compelling narrative and business context require human touch.
AI computes sample sizes and analyzes results but experiment design requires business understanding.
AutoML handles standard prediction tasks but complex, high-stakes models need careful human oversight.
Determining causation (not just correlation) requires careful experimental design and domain judgment.
Translating vague business questions into precise, answerable data science problems is uniquely human.
Presenting findings to non-technical executives and influencing decisions requires human persuasion.

companies.name: DataRobot
companies.threat: End-to-end AutoML that builds, deploys, and monitors models with minimal human intervention

companies.name: Julius AI
companies.threat: Chat-based data analysis that handles EDA, modeling, and visualization from plain English

companies.name: H2O.ai
companies.threat: Fully automated feature engineering, model building, and deployment pipeline

companies.name: Hex
companies.threat: AI-powered notebook that generates analysis, visualizations, and reports from questions

companies.name: Tableau
companies.threat: Natural language to insights — business users bypass data scientists for standard analytics

timeline.description: Business analysts do basic data science with AI tools. Data scientists focus on complex modeling and causal inference.
AI handles 80% of standard analytics. Data scientists become decision scientists and AI strategists.
Routine data science is fully automated. Human data scientists work on causal reasoning, ethics, and novel analytical approaches.

skills.description: The hardest analytical skill to automate — understanding why things happen, not just what happened.
Frame problems, design decisions under uncertainty, and quantify business impact — deeply human.
Use LLMs for unstructured data analysis, text mining, and building AI-powered analytical tools.
Deep knowledge of healthcare, finance, or any vertical makes your analysis 10x more valuable.
Transform complex findings into compelling narratives that drive executive decisions.
